column1: Barueri (Portuguese pronunciation: [bɐˌɾu.eˈɾi] or [baɾweˈɾi]) is a Brazilian municipality in the State of São Paulo located in the northwestern part of the Metropolitan Region of São Paulo. The population is 262
column2: 275 (2015 est.) in an area of 65.70 km2 (25.37 sq mi).Its boundaries are Santana de Parnaíba to the north
column5: Jandira to the south and southwest
column6: and Itapevi the west. The city is served by the trains of line 8 of the Companhia Paulista de Trens Metropolitanos (literally São Paulo Metropolitan Railway Company)

column1: Barueri means "Red flower that amazes" in a Tupi–Guarani language. According to historians
column2: the history of Barueri dates back to November 11
column3: 1560 with the establishment of Nossa Senhora Da Escada Chapel by jesuit missionary José de Anchieta and his further settlement. The hamlet grew to the point of the construction
column4: in 1870 of the Sorocabana Railway that initiated its duties in 1875 turning Barueri into an important point of connection between São Paulo
column5: Santana de Parnaíba and Pirapora do Bom Jesus. Still belonging to the city of Santana de Parnaíba
column6: Barueri was established as an independent city on December 24
column8: the city's territory shrank to two thirds of its original size when Carapicuíba emancipated from it.

column6: Walmart Brasil and others have their headquarters in Barueri.

column1: The most notable football (soccer) club in the city is Grêmio Barueri
column3: in 2009 played in the Brazilian top league. In February 2010 the team was moved to Presidente Prudente
column4: a city that is located in western São Paulo (state). After moving to Presidente Prudente the team's new home stadium was Estádio Eduardo José Farah
column5: which has a maximum capacity of 44

column1: At the same time Campinas Futebol Clube
column2: relocated to Barueri and became Sport Club Barueri.In 2006
column3: some 2006 FIBA World Championship for Women basketball matches were hosted at the city's Barueri Arena
column4: which is an indoor sporting arena.
